question.body: Phagocytes are stimulated to go to a site of infection by _________________ , which results in ______________.

multiple_choice.choice: A chemical from the microbe, opsonization
A chemical from the microbe, chemotaxis
Damaged tissue cells, digestion of normal tissue

response.feedback: Incorrect. Opsonization does not require proteins from the damaged cell.
Incorrect. Leukotrienes are correct, but their secretion results in chemotaxis and increased adherence.
Incorrect. Activiated complement stimulates chemotaxis and can lead to opsonization.
Correct. There are many chemotactic signals and damaged tissue is one of them.
Incorrect. Microbes do not secrete chemical signals to which the immune system responds.
Incorrect. Damaged tissue cells are the signals for phagocytes, but they do not attack normal tissues.
